label: wherethetimegoes
description:

Kane and Astrid Sonne, and tipped if yr on the spectrum between any of those trip/dream-pop integers.

OK what’s the craic here, then? As far as we can tell, Princ€ss are somehow related to shadowy label wherethetimegoes and wish to... more

label: wherethetimegoes
description:
Following up an acclaimed amphibious debut 'Frog Of Earth', Mel Keane fills an empty world with 'Airs', fermenting fragments of folk, sacred music and birdsong into pungent electro-acoustic daydreams. RIYL Atte Elias Kantonen or Oval.

Like its predecessor, 'Airs' is a demonstration of Dublin-based Keane's virtuosic sound design skills, but it's not showy. While 'Frog Of Earth' attempted to unravel the outside world from the perspective of an amphibian, 'Airs' imagines an open, untouched... more

label: Moikai
description: The first release on Jim O'Rourke's legendary Moikai imprint in over two decades, 'Spectral Evolution' is a defining statement from Portuguese vanguard Rafael Toral, an album of subtly orchestral, jazz-inspired guitar music that's been slowed to a vertiginous crawl. Using his arsenal of hand-made synths to sing like birds around stretched, steel-wound drones, he evokes Bach, Loren Connors, Gavin Bryars and Rhys Chatham on a longform piece full of conventional chord progressions and... more

label: AD 93
description:
Jasmine Wood takes her piano to church on 'Piano Reverb', recording the keys' sustained trails and layering them into ghostly, ambient compositions that convulse and captivate.

Wood was struck by the sheer number of empty churches that surrounded her when she moved to Ireland, so she took matters into her own hands and decided to use the vast, reverberant space to anchor 'Piano Reverb'. She hauled her antique Blüthner grand piano into a vacant church hall, and while she spent a year... more

release: Under the Island - Experimental Music in Ireland 1960-1994
title_full:
Various Artists

              —
              Under the Island - Experimental Music in Ireland 1960-1994
            
              (Nyahh Records)
label: Nyahh Records
description:
Incredible survey of DIY and avant curios from Ireland sourced from years of digging and sorting through obscure, overlooked morsels of concrète poitín, ferric tone poems, hallucinatory noise and wraithlike laments for posterity.

With a pure focus on works produced within the island, ‘Experimental Music in Ireland 1960-1994’ plunges intrepid ears into imaginative microcosms of music practically unheard beyond the bedrooms and non-studios of their makers. It firmly builds on an... more

title_full:
Chanel Beads

              —
              Your Day Will Come
            
              (Jagjaguwar)
label: Jagjaguwar
ESCHO
description:
Chinah's Fine, aka the sampled voice on Two Shell's 'Home', comes correct on her debut solo album, focusing her songwriting and coming up with a deceptively minimal, electronically-enhanced vision of homespun folk-pop - somewhere between Mazzy Star and ML Buch.

Even though 'Rocky Top Ballads' is Fine's first fully fleshed-out solo offering, she operates from the center of Denmark's fertile alt-pop scene. One half of Coined alongside Astrid Sonne, a part of Clarissa Connelly's Canons group... more
